Articles.Content:
Hey guys, thanks to some posts on DayZ forums I've been looking into this again...then the youtube videos have basically convinced me to buy this, something I probably should have done as soon as I saw this on Steam back in March.

Anyway, I wanted to say hi, but I also have two questions.

1) Is there any difference between buying this on Steam compared to buying it straight from here?

2) Is the demo laggier than the "full" game?

Welcome to the forums!

1) No, there is no difference between steam compared to buying it straight from the website.

2) I don't know. The newest version has a little more lag people say, but I am not sure.

Thanks for the reply, welcome, and answers.

I look forward to this...again, and this time I think I'll actually buy it.
Next update will contain some performance fixes, so it should get overall better. Anyways, welcome to the game, and our community. Hopefully you will have a great time here

Welp, the deed has been done and I've finally let loose the money to buy this.

Now I'm learning myself something with a Scott Manley tutorial. And here I actually expected orbit to be easier than it is.

Welcome to the community Diggydug

The Windows Steam version checks for Steam when you start it, and it's easier to have several installs of KSP with the store version, but other than that they are the same.

The full game might be laggier for you but then it has a few more graphical niceties now
